      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>promethean</catalog>
            <entry>10140</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en-US">Introduction to Light</string>
          </title>
          <language>en-US</language>
          <description>
            <string language="en-US">This flipchart introduces fifth graders to the science of light. Principles such as transparent, translucent, opaque, reflection, and refraction are covered. Concave and convex mirrors and lenses are also covered. There are links to fun websites about light and many opportunities for student participation in the lesson. An activote assessment at the end allows students to demonstrate what they have learned.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-US">light</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-US">refraction</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-US">reflection</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-US">mirrors</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-US">lenses</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-US">Science</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-US">Physical Science</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
